  129: -define(SLEEP, 500).
  130: -define(CORRECT_PASSWORD, "hello test").
  131: -define(INCORRECT_PASSWORD, "hello").
  132: -define(BADARG_PASSWORD, hello).

  134: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  135: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
  136: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  137: 
  138: all() ->
  139:     [
  140:      {group, 'tlsv1.3'},
  141:      {group, 'tlsv1.2'},
  142:      {group, 'tlsv1.1'},
  143:      {group, 'tlsv1'}
  144:     ].
  145: 
  146: groups() ->
  147:     [
  148:      {'tlsv1.3', [],  (api_tests() ++  [tls_13_reject_change_cipher_spec_as_first_msg,
  149:                                         tls_13_middlebox_reject_change_cipher_spec_as_first_msg]) -- [sockname]},
  150:      {'tlsv1.2', [],  api_tests()},
  151:      {'tlsv1.1', [],  api_tests()},
  152:      {'tlsv1', [],  api_tests()}
  153:     ].
  154: 
  155: api_tests() ->
  156:     [
  157:      tls_upgrade,
  158:      tls_upgrade_new_opts,
  159:      tls_upgrade_new_opts_with_sni_fun,
  160:      tls_upgrade_with_timeout,
  161:      tls_upgrade_with_client_timeout,
  162:      tls_downgrade,
  163:      tls_shutdown,
  164:      tls_shutdown_write,
  165:      tls_shutdown_both,
  166:      tls_shutdown_error,
  167:      tls_password_correct,
  168:      tls_password_incorrect,
  169:      tls_password_badarg,
  170:      tls_client_closes_socket,
  171:      tls_closed_in_active_once,
  172:      tls_reset_in_active_once,
  173:      tls_monitor_listener,
  174:      tls_tcp_msg,
  175:      tls_tcp_msg_big,
  176:      tls_dont_crash_on_handshake_garbage,
  177:      tls_tcp_error_propagation_in_active_mode,
  178:      tls_reject_warning_alert_in_initial_hs,
  179:      tls_reject_fake_warning_alert_in_initial_hs,
  180:      tls_app_data_in_initial_hs_state,
  181:      peername,
  182:      sockname,
  183:      tls_server_handshake_timeout,
  184:      transport_close,
  185:      transport_close_in_inital_hello,
  186:      emulated_options,
  187:      accept_pool,
  188:      reuseaddr
  189:     ].
  190: 
  191: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
  192:     catch crypto:stop(),
  193:     try crypto:start() of
  194: 	ok ->
  195: 	    ssl_test_lib:clean_start(),
  196: 	    Config1 = ssl_test_lib:make_rsa_cert_with_protected_keyfile(Config0,
  197:                                                                         ?CORRECT_PASSWORD),
  198:             ssl_test_lib:make_dsa_cert(Config1)
  199:     catch _:_ ->
  200: 	    {skip, "Crypto did not start"}
  201:     end.
  202: 
  203: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  204:     ssl:stop(),
  205:     application:unload(ssl),
  206:     application:stop(crypto).
  207: 
  208: init_per_group(GroupName, Config) ->
  209:     ssl_test_lib:init_per_group(GroupName, Config).
  210: 
  211: end_per_group(GroupName, Config) ->
  212:   ssl_test_lib:end_per_group(GroupName, Config).
  213: 
  214: init_per_testcase(Testcase, Config) when Testcase == tls_server_handshake_timeout;
  215:                                          Testcase == tls_upgrade_with_timeout ->
  216:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  217:     Config;
  218: init_per_testcase(_, Config) ->
  219:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 5}),
  220:     Config.
  221: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  222:     Config.
  223: 
  224: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  225: %% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  226: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  227: tls_upgrade() ->
  228:     [{doc,"Test that you can upgrade an tcp connection to an ssl connection"}].
  229: 
  230: tls_upgrade(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  231:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  232:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  233:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  234:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  235: 
  236:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  237: 						{from, self()},
  238: 						{mfa, {?MODULE,
  239: 						       upgrade_result, []}},
  240: 						{tcp_options,
  241: 						 [{active, false} | TcpOpts]},
  242: 						{ssl_options, [{verify, verify_peer} | ServerOpts]}]),
  243:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  244:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_client([{node, ClientNode},
  245: 						{port, Port},
  246: 				   {host, Hostname},
  247: 				   {from, self()},
  248: 				   {mfa, {?MODULE, upgrade_result, []}},
  249: 				   {tcp_options, [binary]},
  250: 				   {ssl_options,  [{verify, verify_peer},
  251:                                                    {server_name_indication, Hostname} | ClientOpts]}]),
  252: 
  253:     ?CT_LOG("Client ~p  Server ~p ~n", [Client, Server]),
  254: 
  255:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
  256: 
  257:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  258:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  259: 
  260: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  261: tls_upgrade_new_opts() ->
  262:     [{doc,"Test that you can upgrade an tcp connection to an ssl connection and give new socket opts"}].
  263: 
  264: tls_upgrade_new_opts(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  265:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  266:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  267:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  268:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  269: 
  270:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  271: 						{from, self()},
  272: 						{mfa, {?MODULE,
  273: 						       upgrade_result_new_opts, []}},
  274: 						{tcp_options,
  275: 						 [{active, false} | TcpOpts]},
  276: 						{ssl_options, [{verify, verify_peer},
  277:                                                                {mode, list} | ServerOpts]}]),
  278:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  279:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_client([{node, ClientNode},
  280: 						{port, Port},
  281: 				   {host, Hostname},
  282: 				   {from, self()},
  283: 				   {mfa, {?MODULE, upgrade_result_new_opts, []}},
  284: 				   {tcp_options, [binary]},
  285: 				   {ssl_options,  [{verify, verify_peer},
  286:                                                    {mode, list},
  287:                                                    {server_name_indication, Hostname} | ClientOpts]}]),
  288: 
  289:     ?CT_LOG("Client ~p  Server ~p ~n", [Client, Server]),
  290: 
  291:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
  292: 
  293:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  294:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  295: 
  296: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  297: tls_upgrade_new_opts_with_sni_fun() ->
  298:     [{doc,"Test that you can upgrade an tcp connection to an ssl connection with new versions option provided by sni_fun"}].
  299: 
  300: tls_upgrade_new_opts_with_sni_fun(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  301:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  302:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  303:     ServerDsaOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_dsa_opts, Config),
  304:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  305:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  306:     Version = ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config),
  307:     NewVersions = new_versions(Version),
  308:     Ciphers =  ssl:filter_cipher_suites(ssl:cipher_suites(all, Version), []),
  309: 
  310:     NewOpts = [{versions, NewVersions},
  311:                {ciphers, Ciphers},
  312:                {verify, verify_peer}],
  313: 
  314:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_server(
  315:                [{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  316:                 {from, self()},
  317:                 {mfa, {?MODULE, upgrade_result, []}},
  318:                 {tcp_options,
  319:                  [{active, false} | TcpOpts]},
  320:                 {ssl_options, [{versions, [Version |NewVersions]},
  321:                                {sni_fun, fun(_SNI) -> ServerOpts ++ NewOpts end}
  322:                               | ServerDsaOpts]}]),
  323:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  324:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_client(
  325:                [{node, ClientNode},
  326:                 {port, Port},
  327:                 {host, Hostname},
  328:                 {from, self()},
  329:                 {mfa, {?MODULE, upgrade_result, []}},
  330:                 {tcp_options, [binary]},
  331:                 {ssl_options,  [{versions,  [Version |NewVersions]},
  332:                                 {ciphers, Ciphers},
  333:                                 {server_name_indication, Hostname} | ClientOpts]}]),
  334: 
  335:     ?CT_LOG("Client ~p  Server ~p ~n", [Client, Server]),
  336: 
  337:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
  338: 
  339:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  340:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  341: 
  342: 
  343: 
  344: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  345: tls_upgrade_with_timeout() ->
  346:     [{doc,"Test handshake/3"}].
  347: 
  348: tls_upgrade_with_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  349:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  350:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  351:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  352:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  353: 
  354:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  355: 						{from, self()},
  356: 						{timeout, 5000},
  357: 						{mfa, {?MODULE,
  358: 						       upgrade_result, []}},
  359: 						{tcp_options,
  360: 						 [{active, false} | TcpOpts]},
  361: 						{ssl_options, [{verify, verify_peer} | ServerOpts]}]),
  362:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  363:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_client([{node, ClientNode},
  364: 						{port, Port},
  365: 						{host, Hostname},
  366: 						{from, self()},
  367: 						{mfa, {?MODULE, upgrade_result, []}},
  368: 						{tcp_options, TcpOpts},
  369: 						{ssl_options, [{verify, verify_peer},
  370:                                                                {server_name_indication, Hostname} | ClientOpts]}]),
  371: 
  372:     ?CT_LOG("Client ~p  Server ~p ~n", [Client, Server]),
  373: 
  374:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
  375: 
  376:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  377:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  378: 
  379: tls_upgrade_with_client_timeout() ->
  380:     [{doc,"Test upgrade with connect/3 and a timeout value"}].
  381: 
  382: tls_upgrade_with_client_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  383:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  384:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  385:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  386:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  387: 
  388:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  389: 						{from, self()},
  390: 						{mfa, {?MODULE,
  391: 						       upgrade_result, []}},
  392: 						{tcp_options,
  393: 						 [{active, false} | TcpOpts]},
  394: 						{ssl_options, [{verify, verify_peer} | ServerOpts]}]),
  395:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  396:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_client_error([{node, ClientNode},
  397: 						{port, Port},
  398: 				   {host, Hostname},
  399: 				   {from, self()},
  400:                                    {timeout, 0},
  401: 				   {mfa, {?MODULE, upgrade_result, []}},
  402: 				   {tcp_options, [binary]},
  403: 				   {ssl_options,  [{verify, verify_peer},
  404:                                                    {server_name_indication, Hostname} | ClientOpts]}]),
  405: 
  406:     ?CT_LOG("Client ~p  Server ~p", [Client, Server]),
  407:     ok = ssl_test_lib:check_result(Client, {error, timeout}),
  408:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server).
  409: 
  410: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  411: tls_downgrade() ->
  412:       [{doc,"Test that you can downgarde an ssl connection to an tcp connection"}].
  413: tls_downgrade(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  414:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  415:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  416: 
  417:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  418: 
  419:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  420: 					{from, self()},
  421: 					{mfa, {?MODULE, tls_downgrade_result, [self()]}},
  422: 					{options, [{active, false}, {verify, verify_peer} | ServerOpts]}]),
  423:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  424:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  425: 					{host, Hostname},
  426: 					{from, self()},
  427: 					{mfa, {?MODULE, tls_downgrade_result, [self()]}},
  428: 					{options, [{active, false}, {verify, verify_peer} | ClientOpts]}]),
  429: 
  430:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ready, Client, ready),
  431: 
  432:     Server ! go,
  433:     Client ! go,
  434: 
  435:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
  436:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  437:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  438: 
  439: 
  440: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  441: tls_shutdown() ->
  442:     [{doc,"Test API function ssl:shutdown/2"}].
  443: tls_shutdown(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  444:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  445:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  446:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  447:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  448: 					{from, self()},
  449: 			   {mfa, {?MODULE, tls_shutdown_result, [server]}},
  450: 			   {options, [{exit_on_close, false},
  451: 				      {active, false} | ServerOpts]}]),
  452:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  453:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  454: 					{host, Hostname},
  455: 					{from, self()},
  456: 					{mfa,
  457: 					 {?MODULE, tls_shutdown_result, [client]}},
  458: 					{options,
  459: 					 [{exit_on_close, false},
  460: 					  {active, false} | ClientOpts]}]),
  461: 
  462:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
  463: 
  464:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  465:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  466: 
  467: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  468: tls_shutdown_write() ->
  469:     [{doc,"Test API function ssl:shutdown/2 with option write."}].
  470: tls_shutdown_write(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  471:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  472:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  473:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  474:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  475: 					{from, self()},
  476: 			   {mfa, {?MODULE, tls_shutdown_write_result, [server]}},
  477: 			   {options, [{active, false} | ServerOpts]}]),
  478:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  479:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  480: 					{host, Hostname},
  481: 			   {from, self()},
  482: 			   {mfa, {?MODULE, tls_shutdown_write_result, [client]}},
  483: 			   {options, [{active, false} | ClientOpts]}]),
  484: 
  485:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, {error, closed}).
  486: 
  487: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  488: tls_shutdown_both() ->
  489:     [{doc,"Test API function ssl:shutdown/2 with option both."}].
  490: tls_shutdown_both(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  491:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  492:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  493:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  494:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  495: 					{from, self()},
  496: 			   {mfa, {?MODULE, tls_shutdown_both_result, [server]}},
  497: 			   {options, [{active, false} | ServerOpts]}]),
  498:     Port  = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  499:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  500: 					{host, Hostname},
  501: 			   {from, self()},
  502: 			   {mfa, {?MODULE, tls_shutdown_both_result, [client]}},
  503: 			   {options, [{active, false} | ClientOpts]}]),
  504: 
  505:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, {error, closed}).
  506: 
  507: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  508: tls_shutdown_error() ->
  509:     [{doc,"Test ssl:shutdown/2 error handling"}].
  510: tls_shutdown_error(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  511:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  512:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(node()),
  513:     {ok, Listen} = ssl:listen(Port, ServerOpts),
  514:     {error, enotconn} = ssl:shutdown(Listen, read_write),
  515:     ok = ssl:close(Listen),
  516:     {error, closed} = ssl:shutdown(Listen, read_write).
  517: 
  518: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  519: tls_client_closes_socket() ->
  520:     [{doc,"Test what happens when client closes socket before handshake is completed"}].
  521: 
  522: tls_client_closes_socket(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  523:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  524:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  525:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  526: 
  527:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_server_error([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  528: 						      {from, self()},
  529: 						      {tcp_options, TcpOpts},
  530: 						      {ssl_options, ServerOpts}]),
  531:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  532: 
  533:     Connect = fun() ->
  534: 		      {ok, _Socket} = rpc:call(ClientNode, gen_tcp, connect,
  535: 					      [Hostname, Port, [binary]]),
  536: 		      %% Make sure that handshake is called before
  537: 		      %% client process ends and closes socket.
  538: 		      ct:sleep(?SLEEP)
  539: 	      end,
  540: 
  541:     _Client = spawn_link(Connect),
  542: 
  543:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, {error,closed}).
  544: 
  545: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  546: tls_reset_in_active_once() ->
  547:     [{doc, "Test that ssl_closed is delivered in active once with non-empty buffer, check ERL-420."}].
  548: 
  549: tls_reset_in_active_once(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  550:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  551:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  552:     {_ClientNode, _ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  553:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  554:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(node()),
  555:     Server = fun() ->
  556: 		     {ok, Listen} = gen_tcp:listen(Port, TcpOpts),
  557: 		     {ok, TcpServerSocket} = gen_tcp:accept(Listen),
  558: 		     {ok, ServerSocket} = ssl:handshake(TcpServerSocket, ServerOpts),
  559: 		     lists:foreach(
  560: 		       fun(_) ->
  561: 			       ssl:send(ServerSocket, "some random message\r\n")
  562: 		       end, lists:seq(1, 20)),
  563: 		     %% Close TCP instead of SSL socket to trigger the bug:
  564: 		     gen_tcp:close(TcpServerSocket),
  565: 		     gen_tcp:close(Listen)
  566: 	     end,
  567:     spawn_link(Server),
  568:     {ok, Socket} = ssl:connect(Hostname, Port, [{active, false} | ClientOpts]),
  569:     Result = tls_closed_in_active_once_loop(Socket),
  570:     ssl:close(Socket),
  571:     case Result of
  572: 	ok -> ok;
  573: 	_ -> ct:fail(Result)
  574:     end.
  575: 
  576: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  577: tls_closed_in_active_once() ->
  578:     [{doc, "Test that active once can be used to deliver not only all data"
  579:       " but even the close message, see ERL-1409, in normal operation."
  580:       " This is also test, with slightly different circumstances in"
  581:       " the old tls_closed_in_active_once test"
  582:       " renamed tls_reset_in_active_once"}].
  583: 
  584: tls_closed_in_active_once(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  585:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  586:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  587:     {_ClientNode, _ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  588:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  589:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(node()),
  590:     Server = fun() ->
  591: 		     {ok, Listen} = gen_tcp:listen(Port, TcpOpts),
  592: 		     {ok, TcpServerSocket} = gen_tcp:accept(Listen),
  593: 		     {ok, ServerSocket} = ssl:handshake(TcpServerSocket, ServerOpts),
  594: 		     lists:foreach(
  595: 		       fun(_) ->
  596: 			       ssl:send(ServerSocket, "some random message\r\n")
  597: 		       end, lists:seq(1, 20)),
  598: 		     ssl:close(ServerSocket)
  599: 	     end,
  600:     spawn_link(Server),
  601:     {ok, Socket} = ssl:connect(Hostname, Port, [{active, false} | ClientOpts]),
  602:     Result = tls_closed_in_active_once_loop(Socket),
  603:     ssl:close(Socket),
  604:     case Result of
  605: 	ok -> ok;
  606: 	_ -> ct:fail(Result)
  607:     end.
  608: 
  609: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  610: tls_monitor_listener() ->
  611:     [{doc, "Check that TLS server processes are shutdown when listener socket is closed."
  612:       "Note that individual already established connections may live longer."}].
  613: 
  614: tls_monitor_listener(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  615:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  616:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  617:     Version = ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config),
  618:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  619: 
  620:     Server1 = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  621: 					{from, self()},
  622:                                          {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
  623:                                          {options, tls_monitor_listen_opts(Version, ServerOpts)}]),
  624:     Port1 = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server1),
  625: 
  626:     Server2 = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  627: 					{from, self()},
  628:                                          {options, tls_monitor_listen_opts(Version, ServerOpts)}]),
  629:     _Port2 = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server2),
  630: 
  631:     2 = count_children(workers, ssl_listen_tracker_sup),
  632: 
  633:     Sessions = session_info(Version),
  634: 
  635:     true = (Sessions == 2),
  636: 
  637:     Client1 = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port1},
  638:                                          {host, Hostname},
  639:                                          {from, self()},
  640:                                          {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
  641:                                          {options, tls_monitor_client_opts(Version, ClientOpts)}
  642: 					]),
  643: 
  644:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server1, ok, Client1, ok),
  645:     Monitor = erlang:monitor(process, Server1),
  646:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server1),
  647:     receive
  648:         {'DOWN', Monitor, _, _, _} ->
  649:             ct:sleep(1000)
  650:     end,
  651: 
  652: 
  653:     Sessions1 = session_info(Version),
  654:     true = (Sessions1 == 1),
  655: 
  656:     1 = count_children(workers, ssl_listen_tracker_sup).
  657: 
  658: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  659: tls_tcp_msg() ->
  660:     [{doc,"Test what happens when a tcp tries to connect, i,e. a bad (ssl) packet is sent first"}].
  661: 
  662: tls_tcp_msg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  663:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  664:     {_, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  665:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}, {active, false}],
  666: 
  667:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_server_error([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  668: 						      {from, self()},
  669: 						      {timeout, 5000},
  670: 						      {mfa, {?MODULE, dummy, []}},
  671: 						      {tcp_options, TcpOpts},
  672: 						      {ssl_options, ServerOpts}]),
  673:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  674: 
  675:     {ok, Socket} = gen_tcp:connect(Hostname, Port, [binary, {packet, 0}]),
  676:     ?CT_LOG("connected to Server ~p ~n", [Server]),
  677:     gen_tcp:send(Socket, "<SOME GARBLED NON SSL MESSAGE>"),
  678: 
  679:     receive
  680: 	{tcp_closed, Socket} ->
  681: 	    receive
  682: 		{Server, {error, Error}} ->
  683: 		    ?CT_LOG("Error ~p", [Error])
  684: 	    end
  685:     end.
  686: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  687: tls_tcp_msg_big() ->
  688:     [{doc,"Test what happens when a tcp tries to connect, i,e. a bad big (ssl) packet is sent first"}].
  689: 
  690: tls_tcp_msg_big(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  691:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  692:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  693:     {_, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  694:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  695: 
  696:     Rand = crypto:strong_rand_bytes(?MAX_CIPHER_TEXT_LENGTH+1),
  697:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_server_error([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  698: 						      {from, self()},
  699: 						      {timeout, 5000},
  700: 						      {mfa, {?MODULE, dummy, []}},
  701: 						      {tcp_options, TcpOpts},
  702: 						      {ssl_options, ServerOpts}]),
  703:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  704: 
  705:     {ok, Socket} = gen_tcp:connect(Hostname, Port, [binary, {packet, 0}]),
  706:     ?CT_LOG("connected to Server ~p ~n", [Server]),
  707: 
  708:     gen_tcp:send(Socket, <<?BYTE(0),
  709: 			   ?BYTE(3), ?BYTE(1), ?UINT16(?MAX_CIPHER_TEXT_LENGTH), Rand/binary>>),
  710: 
  711:     receive
  712: 	{tcp_closed, Socket} ->
  713: 	    receive
  714: 		{Server, {error, timeout}} ->
  715: 		    ct:fail("hangs");
  716: 		{Server, {error, Error}} ->
  717: 		    ?CT_LOG("Error ~p", [Error]);
  718: 		{'EXIT', Server, _} ->
  719: 		    ok
  720: 	    end
  721:     end.
  722: 
  723: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  724: tls_dont_crash_on_handshake_garbage() ->
  725:     [{doc, "Ensure SSL server worker thows an alert on garbage during handshake "
  726:       "instead of crashing and exposing state to user code"}].
  727: 
  728: tls_dont_crash_on_handshake_garbage(Config) ->
  729:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  730:     Version = ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config),
  731:     {_ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  732: 
  733:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  734:                                         {from, self()},
  735:                                         {mfa, ssl_test_lib, no_result},
  736:                                         {options, [{versions, [Version]} | ServerOpts]}]),
  737:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  738: 
  739:     {ok, Socket} = gen_tcp:connect(Hostname, Port, [binary, {active, false}]),
  740: 
  741:     %% Send hello and garbage record
  742:     ok = gen_tcp:send(Socket,
  743:                       [<<22, 3,3, 49:16, 1, 45:24, 3,3, % client_hello
  744:                          16#deadbeef:256, % 32 'random' bytes = 256 bits
  745:                          0, 6:16, 0,255, 0,61, 0,57, 1, 0 >>, % some hello values
  746:                        <<22, 3,3, 5:16, 92,64,37,228,209>> % garbage
  747:                       ]),
  748:     %% Send unexpected change_cipher_spec
  749:     ok = gen_tcp:send(Socket, <<20, 3,3, 12:16, 111,40,244,7,137,224,16,109,197,110,249,152>>),
  750:     gen_tcp:close(Socket),
  751:     % Ensure we receive an alert, not sudden disconnect
  752:     case Version of
  753:         'tlsv1.3' ->
  754:             ssl_test_lib:check_server_alert(Server, protocol_version);
  755:         _  ->
  756:             ssl_test_lib:check_server_alert(Server, handshake_failure)
  757:     end.
  758: 
  759: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  760: tls_tcp_error_propagation_in_active_mode() ->
  761:     [{doc,"Test that process receives {ssl_error, Socket, closed} when tcp error ocurres"}].
  762: tls_tcp_error_propagation_in_active_mode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  763:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  764:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  765: 
  766:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  767: 
  768:     Server  = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  769: 					 {from, self()},
  770: 					 {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  771: 					 {options, ServerOpts}]),
  772:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  773:     {Client, #sslsocket{pid=[Pid|_]} = SslSocket} = ssl_test_lib:start_client([return_socket,
  774:                                                                                {node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  775:                                                                                {host, Hostname},
  776:                                                                                {from, self()},
  777:                                                                                {mfa, {?MODULE, receive_msg, []}},
  778:                                                                                {options, ClientOpts}]),
  779: 
  780:     {status, _, _, StatusInfo} = sys:get_status(Pid),
  781:     [_, _,_, _, Prop] = StatusInfo,
  782:     State = ssl_test_lib:state(Prop),
  783:     StaticEnv = element(2, State),
  784:     Socket = element(11, StaticEnv),
  785:     %% Fake tcp error
  786:     Pid ! {tcp_error, Socket, etimedout},
  787: 
  788:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Client, {ssl_closed, SslSocket}).
  789: 
  790: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  791: tls_reject_warning_alert_in_initial_hs() ->
  792:     [{doc,"Test sending warning ALERT instead of client hello"}].
  793: tls_reject_warning_alert_in_initial_hs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  794:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  795:     {_Clientnode, ServerNode, _Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  796:     {Major, Minor} = case ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config, tuple) of
  797:                          ?TLS_1_3 ->
  798:                              ?TLS_1_2;
  799:                          Other ->
  800:                              Other
  801:                      end,
  802:     Server  = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  803: 					 {from, self()},
  804: 					 {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  805: 					 {options, [{versions, [ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config)]} | ServerOpts]}]),
  806:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  807:     {ok, Socket}  = gen_tcp:connect("localhost", Port, [{active, false}, binary]),
  808:     NoRenegotiateAlert = <<?BYTE(?ALERT), ?BYTE(Major), ?BYTE(Minor), ?UINT16(2), ?BYTE(?WARNING), ?BYTE(?NO_RENEGOTIATION)>>,
  809:     gen_tcp:send(Socket, NoRenegotiateAlert),
  810:     UnexpectedMsgAlert = <<?BYTE(?ALERT), ?BYTE(Major), ?BYTE(Minor), ?UINT16(2), ?BYTE(?FATAL), ?BYTE(?UNEXPECTED_MESSAGE)>>,
  811:     {ok, UnexpectedMsgAlert} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 7),
  812:     {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 0).
  813: 
  814: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  815: tls_reject_fake_warning_alert_in_initial_hs() ->
  816:     [{doc,"Test sending 'fake' warning ALERT covers different function clause pre TLS-1.3"}].

  821:                          ?TLS_1_3 ->
  822:                              ?TLS_1_2;
  823:                          Other ->
  824:                              Other
  825:                      end,
  826:     Server  = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  827: 					 {from, self()},
  828: 					 {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},

  830:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  831:     {ok, Socket}  = gen_tcp:connect("localhost", Port, [{active, false}, binary]),
  832:     NoRenegotiateAlert = <<?BYTE(?ALERT), ?BYTE(Major), ?BYTE(Minor), ?UINT16(2), ?BYTE(?WARNING), ?BYTE(?UNEXPECTED_MESSAGE)>>,
  833:     gen_tcp:send(Socket, NoRenegotiateAlert),
  834:     UnexpectedMsgAlert = <<?BYTE(?ALERT), ?BYTE(Major), ?BYTE(Minor), ?UINT16(2), ?BYTE(?FATAL), ?BYTE(?UNEXPECTED_MESSAGE)>>,
  835:     {ok, UnexpectedMsgAlert} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 7),

  838: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  839: tls_app_data_in_initial_hs_state() ->
  840:      [{doc,"Test sending application data instead of initial client hello. In TLS-1.3 application data can be sent",
  841:        "in first round trip but not before client hello."}].
  842: tls_app_data_in_initial_hs_state(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  843:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  844:     {_ClientNode, ServerNode, _Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  845:     Version = ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config, tuple),
  846:     {Major, Minor} = case Version of
  847:                          ?TLS_1_3 ->
  848:                              ?TLS_1_2;
  849:                          Other ->
  850:                              Other
  851:                      end,
  852:     Server  = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  853: 					 {from, self()},
  854: 					 {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  855: 					 {options, [{versions, [ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config)]} | ServerOpts]}]),
  856:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  857:     {ok, Socket}  = gen_tcp:connect("localhost", Port, [{active, false}, binary]),
  858:     AppData = case Version of
  859:                   ?TLS_1_3 ->
  860:                       <<?BYTE(?APPLICATION_DATA), ?BYTE(3), ?BYTE(3), ?UINT16(4), ?BYTE($F), 
  861:                         ?BYTE($O), ?BYTE($O), ?BYTE(?APPLICATION_DATA)>>;
  862:                   _ ->
  863:                      <<?BYTE(?APPLICATION_DATA), ?BYTE(Major), ?BYTE(Minor), 
  864:                        ?UINT16(3), ?BYTE($F), ?BYTE($O), ?BYTE($O)>>
  865:               end,
  866:     gen_tcp:send(Socket, AppData),
  867:     UnexpectedMsgAlert = <<?BYTE(?ALERT), ?BYTE(Major), ?BYTE(Minor), ?UINT16(2), 
  868:                            ?BYTE(?FATAL), ?BYTE(?UNEXPECTED_MESSAGE)>>,
  869:     {ok, UnexpectedMsgAlert} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 7),
  870:     {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 0).
  871: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  872: tls_13_reject_change_cipher_spec_as_first_msg() ->
  873:      [{doc,"change_cipher_spec messages can be sent in TLS-1.3 middlebox_comp_mode, but can not be sent as first msg"}].
  874: tls_13_reject_change_cipher_spec_as_first_msg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  875:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  876:     {_ClientNode, ServerNode, _Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  877:     Server  = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  878:                                          {from, self()},
  879:                                          {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  880:                                          {options, [{versions, [ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config)]} | ServerOpts]}]),
  881:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  882:     {ok, Socket}  = gen_tcp:connect("localhost", Port, [{active, false}, binary]),
  883:     ChangeCipherSpec = <<?BYTE(?CHANGE_CIPHER_SPEC), ?BYTE(3), ?BYTE(3),
  884:                          ?UINT16(1), ?BYTE(?CHANGE_CIPHER_SPEC_PROTO)>>,
  885:     gen_tcp:send(Socket, ChangeCipherSpec),
  886:     UnexpectedMsgAlert = <<?BYTE(?ALERT), ?BYTE(3), ?BYTE(3), ?UINT16(2),
  887:                            ?BYTE(?FATAL), ?BYTE(?UNEXPECTED_MESSAGE)>>,
  888:     {ok, UnexpectedMsgAlert} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 7),
  889:     {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 0).
  890: 
  891: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  892: tls_13_middlebox_reject_change_cipher_spec_as_first_msg() ->
  893:      [{doc,"change_cipher_spec messages can be sent in TLS-1.3 middlebox_comp_mode, but can not be sent as first msg"}].
  894: tls_13_middlebox_reject_change_cipher_spec_as_first_msg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  895:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  896:     {_ClientNode, ServerNode, _Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  897:     Server  = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  898:                                          {from, self()},
  899:                                          {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  900:                                          {options, [{middlebox_comp_mode, false},
  901:                                                     {versions, [ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config)]}
  902:                                                    | ServerOpts]}]),
  903:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  904:     {ok, Socket}  = gen_tcp:connect("localhost", Port, [{active, false}, binary]),
  905:     ChangeCipherSpec = <<?BYTE(?CHANGE_CIPHER_SPEC), ?BYTE(3), ?BYTE(3),
  906:                          ?UINT16(1), ?BYTE(?CHANGE_CIPHER_SPEC_PROTO)>>,
  907:     gen_tcp:send(Socket, ChangeCipherSpec),
  908:     UnexpectedMsgAlert = <<?BYTE(?ALERT), ?BYTE(3), ?BYTE(3), ?UINT16(2),
  909:                            ?BYTE(?FATAL), ?BYTE(?UNEXPECTED_MESSAGE)>>,
  910:     {ok, UnexpectedMsgAlert} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 7),
  911:     {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 0).
  912: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  913: peername() ->
  914:     [{doc,"Test API function peername/1"}].
  915: 
  916: peername(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  917:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  918:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  919:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  920:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  921: 					{from, self()},
  922: 			   {mfa, {ssl, peername, []}},
  923: 			   {options, ServerOpts}]),
  924:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  925:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  926: 					{host, Hostname},
  927: 					{from, self()},
  928: 					{mfa, {ssl, peername, []}},
  929: 					{options, [{port, 0} | ClientOpts]}]),
  930: 
  931:     ClientPort = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Client),
  932:     ServerIp = ssl_test_lib:node_to_hostip(ServerNode, server),
  933:     ClientIp = ssl_test_lib:node_to_hostip(ClientNode, client),
  934:     ServerMsg = {ok, {ClientIp, ClientPort}},
  935:     ClientMsg = {ok, {ServerIp, Port}},
  936: 
  937:     ?CT_LOG("Client ~p  Server ~p ~n", [Client, Server]),
  938: 
  939:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ServerMsg, Client, ClientMsg),
  940: 
  941:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  942:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  943: 
  944: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  945: sockname() ->
  946:     [{doc,"Test API function sockname/1"}].
  947: sockname(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  948:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  949:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  950:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  951:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  952: 					{from, self()},
  953: 			   {mfa, {ssl, sockname, []}},
  954: 			   {options, ServerOpts}]),
  955:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  956:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  957: 					{host, Hostname},
  958:                                         {from, self()},
  959:                                         {mfa, {ssl, sockname, []}},
  960:                                         {options, [{port, 0} | ClientOpts]}]),
  961: 
  962:     ClientPort = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Client),
  963:     ServerIp = ssl_test_lib:node_to_hostip(ServerNode, server),
  964:     ClientIp = ssl_test_lib:node_to_hostip(ClientNode, client),
  965:     ServerMsg = {ok, {ServerIp, Port}},
  966:     ClientMsg = {ok, {ClientIp, ClientPort}},
  967: 
  968:     ?CT_LOG("Client ~p  Server ~p ~n", [Client, Server]),
  969: 
  970:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ServerMsg, Client, ClientMsg),
  971: 
  972:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  973:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  974: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  975: tls_server_handshake_timeout() ->
  976:     [{doc,"Test server handshake timeout"}].
  977: 
  978: tls_server_handshake_timeout(Config) ->
  979:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  980:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  981:     {_, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  982:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  983: 					{from, self()},
  984: 					{timeout, 5000},
  985: 					{mfa, {ssl_test_lib,
  986: 					       no_result_msg, []}},
  987: 					{options, ServerOpts}]),
  988:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  989:     {ok, CSocket} = gen_tcp:connect(Hostname, Port, [binary, {active, true}]),
  990: 
  991:     receive
  992: 	{tcp_closed, CSocket} ->
  993: 	    ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, {error, timeout}),
  994: 	    receive
  995: 		{'EXIT', Server, _} ->
  996: 		    %% Make sure supervisor had time to react on process exit
  997: 		    %% Could we come up with a better solution to this?
  998: 		    ct:sleep(500),
  999: 		    [] = supervisor:which_children(tls_connection_sup)
 1000: 	    end
 1001:     end.
 1002: 
 1003: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1004: transport_close() ->
 1005:     [{doc, "Test what happens if socket is closed on TCP level after a while of normal operation"}].
 1006: transport_close(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1007:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
 1008:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
 1009:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
 1010:     Server =
 1011: 	ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
 1012: 				   {from, self()},
 1013: 				   {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result, []}},
 1014: 				   {options,  [{active, false} | ServerOpts]}]),
 1015:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
 1016:     {ok, TcpS} = rpc:call(ClientNode, gen_tcp, connect,
 1017: 			  [Hostname,Port,[binary, {active, false}]]),
 1018:     {ok, SslS} = rpc:call(ClientNode, ssl, connect,
 1019: 			  [TcpS,[{active, false}|ClientOpts]]),
 1020: 
 1021:     ?CT_LOG("Server ~p ~n", [Server]),
 1022:     ok = ssl:send(SslS, "Hello world"),
 1023:     {ok,<<"Hello world">>} = ssl:recv(SslS, 11),
 1024:     gen_tcp:close(TcpS),
 1025:     {error, _} = ssl:send(SslS, "Hello world").
 1026: 
 1027: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1028: transport_close_in_inital_hello() ->
 1029:     [{doc, "Test what happens if server dies after calling transport_accept but before initiating handshake."}].
 1030: transport_close_in_inital_hello(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1031:     _ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
 1032:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
 1033:     {_, _, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
 1034:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1035: 
 1036:     Testcase = self(),
 1037: 
 1038:     Acceptor = spawn_link(fun() ->
 1039:                                   {ok, Listen} = ssl:listen(0, ServerOpts),
 1040:                                   {ok, {_, Port}} = ssl:sockname(Listen),
 1041:                                   Testcase ! {port, Port},
 1042:                                   {ok, _Accept} = ssl:transport_accept(Listen),
 1043:                                   receive
 1044:                                       die -> ok
 1045:                                   end
 1046:                           end),
 1047:     Port =  receive
 1048:                 {port, Port0} ->
 1049:                     Port0
 1050:             end,
 1051: 
 1052:     Connector = spawn_link(fun() ->
 1053:                                    {ok, _} = ssl:connect(Hostname, Port,
 1054:                                                          [{verify, verify_none}],
 1055:                                                          infinity
 1056:                                                         )
 1057:                            end),
 1058: 
 1059: 
 1060:     Sup = (whereis(tls_connection_sup)),
 1061: 
 1062:     check_connection_processes(Sup, 2),
 1063: 
 1064:     Acceptor ! die,
 1065: 
 1066:     receive
 1067:          {'EXIT', Acceptor, _} ->
 1068:             ok
 1069:     end,
 1070:     receive
 1071:         {'EXIT', Connector, _} ->
 1072:             ok
 1073:      end,
 1074:     check_connection_processes(Sup, 0).
 1075: 
 1076: check_connection_processes(Sup, N) ->
 1077:     check_connection_processes(Sup, N, 5).
 1078: 
 1079: check_connection_processes(Sup, N, 0) ->
 1080:     N = count_children(supervisors, Sup);
 1081: check_connection_processes(Sup, N, M) ->
 1082:     case count_children(supervisors, Sup) of
 1083:         N ->
 1084:             ok;
 1085:         _ ->
 1086:             ct:sleep(500),
 1087:             check_connection_processes(Sup, N, M-1)
 1088:     end.
 1089: 
 1090: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1091: emulated_options() ->
 1092:     [{doc,"Test API function getopts/2 and setopts/2"}].
 1093: 
 1094: emulated_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1095:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
 1096:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
 1097:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
 1098:     Values = [{mode, list}, {packet, 0}, {header, 0},
 1099: 		      {active, true}],
 1100:     %% Shall be the reverse order of Values!
 1101:     Options = [active, header, packet, mode],
 1102: 
 1103:     NewValues = [{mode, binary}, {active, once}],
 1104:     %% Shall be the reverse order of NewValues!
 1105:     NewOptions = [active, mode],
 1106: 
 1107:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
 1108: 					{from, self()},
 1109: 			   {mfa, {?MODULE, tls_socket_options_result,
 1110: 				  [Options, Values, NewOptions, NewValues]}},
 1111: 			   {options, ServerOpts}]),
 1112:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
 1113:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
 1114: 					{host, Hostname},
 1115: 			   {from, self()},
 1116: 			   {mfa, {?MODULE, tls_socket_options_result,
 1117: 				  [Options, Values, NewOptions, NewValues]}},
 1118: 			   {options, ClientOpts}]),
 1119: 
 1120:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
 1121: 
 1122:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
 1123: 
 1124:     {ok, Listen} = ssl:listen(0, ServerOpts),
 1125:     {ok,[{mode,list}]} = ssl:getopts(Listen, [mode]),
 1126:     ok = ssl:setopts(Listen, [{mode, binary}]),
 1127:     {ok,[{mode, binary}]} = ssl:getopts(Listen, [mode]),
 1128:     {ok,[{recbuf, _}]} = ssl:getopts(Listen, [recbuf]),
 1129:     ssl:close(Listen).
 1130: accept_pool() ->
 1131:     [{doc,"Test having an accept pool."}].
 1132: accept_pool(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1133:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
 1134:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
 1135: 
 1136:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
 1137:     Server0 = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
 1138: 					{from, self()},
 1139: 					{accepters, 3},
 1140: 					{mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
 1141: 					{options, ServerOpts}]),
 1142:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server0),
 1143:     [Server1, Server2] = ssl_test_lib:accepters(2),
 1144: 
 1145:     Client0 = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
 1146: 					 {host, Hostname},
 1147: 					 {from, self()},
 1148: 					 {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
 1149: 					 {options, ClientOpts}
 1150: 					]),
 1151: 
 1152:     Client1 = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
 1153: 					 {host, Hostname},
 1154: 					 {from, self()},
 1155: 					 {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
 1156: 					 {options, ClientOpts}
 1157: 					]),
 1158: 
 1159:     Client2 = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
 1160: 					 {host, Hostname},
 1161: 					 {from, self()},
 1162: 					 {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
 1163: 					 {options, ClientOpts}
 1164: 					]),
 1165: 
 1166:     ssl_test_lib:check_ok([Server0, Server1, Server2, Client0, Client1, Client2]),
 1167: 
 1168:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server0),
 1169:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server1),
 1170:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server2),
 1171:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client0),
 1172:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client1),
 1173:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client2).
 1174:

 1214: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1215: tls_password_correct() ->
 1216:     [{doc, "Test that connection is possible with a correct password"}].
 1217: tls_password_correct(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1218:     F = fun (P) ->
 1219:                 ProtectedClientOpts = ?config(client_protected_rsa_opts, Config),
 1220:                 ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
 1221: 
 1222:                 {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
 1223:                 Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
 1224:                                                     {from, self()},
 1225:                                                     {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result, []}},
 1226:                                                     {options, [{active, false} | ServerOpts]}]),
 1227:                 Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
 1228:                 Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
 1229:                                                     {host, Hostname},
 1230:                                                     {from, self()},
 1231:                                                     {mfa,
 1232:                                                      {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result, []}},
 1233:                                                     {options,
 1234:                                                      [{verify, verify_none},
 1235:                                                       {active, false},
 1236:                                                       {password, P} | ProtectedClientOpts]}]),
 1237:                 ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
 1238:                 ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
 1239:                 ssl_test_lib:close(Client)
 1240:         end,
 1241:     F(?CORRECT_PASSWORD),
 1242:     F(fun() -> ?CORRECT_PASSWORD end).
 1243: 
 1244: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1245: tls_password_incorrect() ->
 1246:     [{doc, "Test that connection is not possible with wrong password"}].
 1247: tls_password_incorrect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1248:     F = fun (P) ->
 1249:                 ProtectedClientOpts = ?config(client_protected_rsa_opts, Config),
 1250:                 ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
 1251: 
 1252:                 {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
 1253:                 Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server_error([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
 1254:                                                           {from, self()},
 1255:                                                           {mfa, ssl_test_lib, no_result},
 1256:                                                           {options, [{active, false} | ServerOpts]}]),
 1257:                 Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
 1258:                 Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client_error([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
 1259:                                                           {host, Hostname},
 1260:                                                           {from, self()},
 1261:                                                           {mfa, ssl_test_lib, no_result},
 1262:                                                           {options,
 1263:                                                            [{active, false},
 1264:                                                             {verify, verify_none},
 1265:                                                             {password, P} | ProtectedClientOpts]}]),
 1266:                 Results = ssl_test_lib:get_result([Server, Client]),
 1267:                 Pred = fun({Pid, {error, closed}}) ->
 1268:                                Server == Pid;
 1269:                           ({Pid, {error, {options, {keyfile, _, {error, _}}}}}) ->
 1270:                                Client == Pid;
 1271:                           (_) -> false
 1272:                        end,
 1273:                 true = lists:all(Pred, Results)
 1274:         end,
 1275:     F(?INCORRECT_PASSWORD),
 1276:     F(fun() -> ?INCORRECT_PASSWORD end).
 1277: 
 1278: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1279: tls_password_badarg() ->
 1280:     [{doc, "Test that connection is not possible with badarg password"}].
 1281: tls_password_badarg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1282:     F = fun (P, ServerError, ClientError) ->
 1283:                 ProtectedClientOpts = ?config(client_protected_rsa_opts, Config),
 1284:                 ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
 1285:                 {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
 1286:                 Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server_error([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
 1287:                                                           {from, self()},
 1288:                                                           {mfa, ssl_test_lib, no_result},
 1289:                                                           {timeout, 100},
 1290:                                                           {options, [{active, false} | ServerOpts]}]),
 1291:                 Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
 1292:                 Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client_error([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
 1293:                                                           {host, Hostname},
 1294:                                                           {from, self()},
 1295:                                                           {mfa, ssl_test_lib, no_result},
 1296:                                                           {options,
 1297:                                                            [{active, false},
 1298:                                                             {verify, verify_none},
 1299:                                                             {password, P} | ProtectedClientOpts]}]),
 1300:                 ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ServerError, Client, ClientError)
 1301:         end,
 1302:     %% {options error comes from ssl app
 1303:     F(?BADARG_PASSWORD, {error, timeout},
 1304:       {error, {options, {password, ?BADARG_PASSWORD}}}),
 1305:     %% {keyfile, badarg} error comes from crypto:macN, also handhsake is initiated
 1306:     %% so different server error is observed
 1307:     F(fun() -> ?BADARG_PASSWORD end, {error, closed},
 1308:       {error, {keyfile,badarg}}).
 1309: 
 1310: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1311: signature_algs() ->
 1312:     [{doc, "Check that listing of signature algorithms for different version and configure combinations"}].
 1313: signature_algs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1314:     true = [] =/= [Alg || Alg <- ssl:signature_algs(default, 'tlsv1.3'), is_tuple(Alg)],
 1315:     true = [] == [Alg || Alg <- ssl:signature_algs(exclusive, 'tlsv1.3'), is_tuple(Alg)],
 1316:     true = ssl:signature_algs(exclusive, 'tlsv1.3') =/=  ssl:signature_algs(exclusive, 'tlsv1.2'),
 1317:     true = length(ssl:signature_algs(defalt, 'tlsv1.2')) <
 1318:         length(ssl:signature_algs(all, 'tlsv1.2')),
 1319:     TLS_1_3_All = ssl:signature_algs(all, 'tlsv1.3'),
 1320:     true = lists:member(rsa_pkcs1_sha512, TLS_1_3_All) andalso (not lists:member({sha512, rsa}, TLS_1_3_All)),
 1321:     true = lists:member(rsa_pkcs1_sha384, TLS_1_3_All) andalso (not lists:member({sha384, rsa}, TLS_1_3_All)),
 1322:     true = lists:member(rsa_pkcs1_sha256, TLS_1_3_All) andalso (not lists:member({sha256, rsa}, TLS_1_3_All)),
 1323:     TLS_1_2_All = ssl:signature_algs(all, 'tlsv1.2'),
 1324:     true = (not lists:member(rsa_pkcs1_sha512, TLS_1_2_All)) andalso lists:member({sha512, rsa}, TLS_1_2_All),
 1325:     true = (not lists:member(rsa_pkcs1_sha384, TLS_1_2_All)) andalso lists:member({sha384, rsa}, TLS_1_2_All),
 1326:     true = (not lists:member(rsa_pkcs1_sha256, TLS_1_2_All)) andalso lists:member({sha256, rsa}, TLS_1_2_All).
 1327: 
 1328: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1329: %% Internal functions ------------------------------------------------
 1330: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1331: 
 1332: upgrade_result(Socket) ->
 1333:     ssl:setopts(Socket, [{active, true}]),
 1334:     ok = ssl:send(Socket, "Hello world"),
 1335:     %% Make sure binary is inherited from tcp socket and that we do
 1336:     %% not get the list default!
 1337:     <<"Hello world">> =  ssl_test_lib:active_recv(Socket, length("Hello world")),
 1338:     ok.
 1339: 
 1340: upgrade_result_new_opts(Socket) ->
 1341:     ssl:setopts(Socket, [{active, true}]),
 1342:     ok = ssl:send(Socket, "Hello world"),
 1343:     %% Make sure list option set in ssl:connect/handshake overrides
 1344:     %% previous gen_tcp socket option that was set to binary.
 1345:     "Hello world" =  ssl_test_lib:active_recv(Socket, length("Hello world")),
 1346:     ok.
 1347: 
 1348: tls_downgrade_result(Socket, Pid) ->
 1349:     ok = ssl_test_lib:send_recv_result(Socket),
 1350:     Pid ! {self(), ready},
 1351:     receive
 1352:         go ->
 1353:             ok
 1354:     end,
 1355:     case ssl:close(Socket, {self(), 10000})  of
 1356: 	{ok, TCPSocket} ->
 1357:             inet:setopts(TCPSocket, [{active, true}]),
 1358: 	    gen_tcp:send(TCPSocket, "Downgraded"),
 1359:             <<"Downgraded">> = active_tcp_recv(TCPSocket, length("Downgraded")),
 1360:             ok;
 1361: 	{ok, TCPSocket, Bin} ->
 1362: 	    gen_tcp:send(TCPSocket, "Downgraded"),
 1363:             <<"Downgraded">> = Bin,
 1364:             ok;
 1365: 	{error, timeout} ->
 1366: 	    ct:comment("Timed out, downgrade aborted"),
 1367: 	    ok;
 1368: 	Fail ->
 1369:             ct:fail(Fail)
 1370:     end.
 1371: 
 1372: tls_shutdown_result(Socket, server) ->
 1373:     ok = ssl:send(Socket, "Hej"),
 1374:     ok = ssl:shutdown(Socket, write),
 1375:     {ok, "Hej hopp"} = ssl:recv(Socket, 8),
 1376:     ok;
 1377: 
 1378: tls_shutdown_result(Socket, client) ->
 1379:     ok = ssl:send(Socket, "Hej hopp"),
 1380:     ok = ssl:shutdown(Socket, write),
 1381:     {ok, "Hej"} = ssl:recv(Socket, 3),
 1382:     ok.
 1383: 
 1384: tls_shutdown_write_result(Socket, server) ->
 1385:     ct:sleep(?SLEEP),
 1386:     ssl:shutdown(Socket, write);
 1387: tls_shutdown_write_result(Socket, client) ->
 1388:     ssl:recv(Socket, 0).
 1389: 
 1390: tls_shutdown_both_result(Socket, server) ->
 1391:     ct:sleep(?SLEEP),
 1392:     ssl:shutdown(Socket, read_write);
 1393: tls_shutdown_both_result(Socket, client) ->
 1394:     ssl:recv(Socket, 0).
 1395: 
 1396: tls_closed_in_active_once_loop(Socket) ->
 1397:     case ssl:setopts(Socket, [{active, once}]) of
 1398:         ok ->
 1399:             receive
 1400:                 {ssl, Socket, _} ->
 1401:                     tls_closed_in_active_once_loop(Socket);
 1402:                 {ssl_closed, Socket} ->
 1403:                     ok
 1404:             end;
 1405:         {error, closed} ->
 1406:             {error, ssl_setopt_failed}
 1407:     end.
 1408: 
 1409: receive_msg(_) ->
 1410:     receive
 1411: 	Msg ->
 1412: 	   Msg
 1413:     end.
 1414: 
 1415: tls_socket_options_result(Socket, Options, DefaultValues, NewOptions, NewValues) ->
 1416:     %% Test get/set emulated opts
 1417:     {ok, DefaultValues} = ssl:getopts(Socket, Options),
 1418:     ssl:setopts(Socket, NewValues),
 1419:     {ok, NewValues} = ssl:getopts(Socket, NewOptions),
 1420:     %% Test get/set inet opts
 1421:     {ok,[{nodelay,false}]} = ssl:getopts(Socket, [nodelay]),
 1422:     ssl:setopts(Socket, [{nodelay, true}]),
 1423:     {ok,[{nodelay, true}]} = ssl:getopts(Socket, [nodelay]),
 1424:     {ok, All} = ssl:getopts(Socket, []),
 1425:     ?CT_LOG("All opts ~p~n", [All]),
 1426:     ok.
 1427: 
 1428: active_tcp_recv(Socket, N) ->
 1429:     active_tcp_recv(Socket, N, []).
 1430: 
 1431: active_tcp_recv(_Socket, 0, Acc) ->
 1432:     Acc;
 1433: active_tcp_recv(Socket, N, Acc) ->
 1434:     receive
 1435: 	{tcp, Socket, Bytes} ->
 1436:             active_tcp_recv(Socket, N-size(Bytes),  Acc ++ Bytes)
 1437:     end.
 1438: 
 1439: tls_monitor_listen_opts('tlsv1.3', Opts) ->
 1440:     [{session_tickets, stateful} | Opts];
 1441: tls_monitor_listen_opts(_, Opts) ->
 1442:     Opts.
 1443: 
 1444: tls_monitor_client_opts('tlsv1.3', Opts) ->
 1445:     [{session_tickets, auto} | Opts];
 1446: tls_monitor_client_opts(_, Opts) ->
 1447:     Opts.
 1448: 
 1449: session_info('tlsv1.3') ->
 1450:     count_children(workers, tls_server_session_ticket_sup);
 1451: session_info(_) ->
 1452:     count_children(workers, ssl_server_session_cache_sup).
 1453: 
 1454: count_children(ChildType, SupRef) ->
 1455:     proplists:get_value(ChildType, supervisor:count_children(SupRef)).
 1456: 
 1457: 
 1458: new_versions('tlsv1.3') ->
 1459:     ['tlsv1.2'];
 1460: new_versions('tlsv1.2') ->
 1461:     ['tlsv1.1'];
 1462: new_versions('tlsv1.1') ->
 1463:     ['tlsv1'];
 1464: new_versions('tlsv1') ->
 1465:     ['tlsv1'].
